clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Intracranially Implanted Carmustine to Treat Recurrent Malignant Glioma
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 3 Study of Carmustine Sustained Release Implant (CASANT) to Treat Recurrent Malignant Glioma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine the safety and efficacy of intracranially implanted Carmustine in the treatment of patients with recurrent malignant glioma.

detailed_description.textblock: Malignant gliomas recur mostly 2 cm within originated area. Local therapies therefore become particular important. Gliadel wafer developed in the States and marketed in the developed countries is an example of such treatments. The product in this study, Carmustine Sustained Release Implant (CASANT), is similar to that of Gliadel wafer as for the API(Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient), but different as for drug delivering system. As required, the preliminary clinical studies were conducted in China. Based on the results of phase I/II , 8-10 wafers containing given dose of BCNU will be administered intracranially in this phase III to the tumor resected cavity to investigate the safety and efficacy in the treatment of recurrent malignant glioma in 212 patients.
